sentences.english: During the dawn period of civilization, the status of the wizard dropped and became the clergy.
sentences.chinese: 到了文明曙光期，巫覡地位下降，終於成爲神職人員。

sentences.english: The church has no ordained clergy.
sentences.chinese: 教會並沒有受戒的神職人員。

sentences.english: The new proposals affect both clergy and laity.
sentences.chinese: 新的建議與神職人員和俗人都有關係。

sentences.english: The color black, the preference of ecclesiastical leaders,was a symbol of authority.
sentences.chinese: 黑色在那時受到神職人員的青睞，是權威的象徵。

sentences.english: For years, the Catholic Church in America has struggled to find new clergy.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，美國天主教會一直在努力尋找新的神職人員。

sentences.english: Some bom had been sent to clerics wra edas gifts.
sentences.chinese: 把炸彈包裹成禮物模樣送到神職人員手上。

sentences.english: Priesthoods based on the worship of a demigod are extremely rare.
sentences.chinese: 崇拜半神的神職人員也是十分的稀有。

sentences.english: Sometimes, not always, the clergy and laity voted in separate chambers.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，並非總是，神職人員和俗人投了單獨的分庭。

sentences.english: Iran's clerics have also climbed the cyber-learning curve.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗的神職人員也在迅速學習運用互聯網。

sentences.english: Clergy and laity alike are divided in their views.
sentences.chinese: 神職人員和信衆同樣都觀點各異。

sentences.english: Lin's maturity could lead him to the ministry.
sentences.chinese: 林的成熟可能會導致他成爲神職人員。

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
